questions.question: 1. In a passband ASK system operating over an AWGN channel, which factor most significantly degrades its performance at low SNR?

explanations.a: Phase distortion affects PSK more than ASK.
explanations.b: ASK performance degrades rapidly at low SNR because amplitude is directly affected by noise.
explanations.c: ASK can be bandwidth efficient with proper filtering.
explanations.d: ASK can use coherent or non-coherent detection, but noise is a larger issue.

questions.question: 2. In coherent passband FSK systems, how is intersymbol interference (ISI) minimized?

explanations.a: Increasing deviation doesn’t inherently remove ISI.
explanations.b: Orthogonal frequencies ensure minimal overlap and eliminate ISI.
explanations.c: Filtering is more applicable in linear modulations like PSK.
explanations.d: Differential encoding addresses phase ambiguity, not ISI.

questions.question: 3. Compared to passband PSK, passband FSK is generally more robust in which type of communication channel?

answers.d: Flat-fading channels with strong phase jitter

explanations.a: PSK may perform better in pure AWGN with coherent detection.
explanations.b: FSK handles frequency selectivity better due to its spectral spread.
explanations.c: FSK can be more immune to narrowband impulsive noise.
explanations.d: FSK is superior under phase jitter because it doesn’t depend on phase.

questions.question: 4. Why is coherent detection preferred over non-coherent detection in passband PSK systems?

answers.b: It improves BER performance by recovering phase information.
answers.d: It makes the system more robust to frequency offset.

explanations.a: Coherent detection is more complex, not simpler.
explanations.b: Recovering phase allows optimal decision boundaries and lower BER.
explanations.c: Bandwidth is unaffected by coherent vs non-coherent detection.
explanations.d: Frequency offset tolerance is not the strength of coherent PSK.

questions.question: 5. What limits the minimum frequency separation in passband binary FSK for orthogonality?

explanations.a: Carrier phase does not affect frequency orthogonality.
explanations.b: Modulation index affects tone spacing, but the base constraint is symbol time.
explanations.c: Orthogonality in FSK is achieved when frequency separation = 1 / symbol duration.

questions.question: 6. In passband ASK systems, what is the main reason it is rarely used in power-constrained wireless applications?

answers.b: It suffers from poor spectral efficiency.
answers.c: It has high peak-to-average power ratio (PAPR).
answers.d: It is highly susceptible to amplitude variations from fading.

explanations.b: Spectral efficiency can be decent depending on shaping.
explanations.c: ASK usually has lower PAPR than multilevel modulations.
explanations.d: Correct: fading affects amplitude severely, degrading ASK signals.

explanations.a: Correct expression for BER in coherent BPSK over AWGN.
explanations.b: This is the expression for some non-coherent schemes.

questions.question: 8. What is the impact of Doppler spread on passband PSK systems in mobile channels?

explanations.a: Timing offset is less influenced by Doppler.
explanations.b: Doppler causes frequency spreading and phase shifts, not just amplitude fading.
explanations.c: Correct: Doppler introduces rapid phase changes, challenging phase tracking.
explanations.d: Doppler usually degrades performance unless counteracted.

questions.question: 9. In passband FSK systems, what is the role of the modulation index (h) in performance?

explanations.a: Timing is not controlled by modulation index.
explanations.b: Correct: h = Δf × Tb; controls frequency separation and impacts bandwidth/ISI.
explanations.c: Phase jitter is a PSK issue.
explanations.d: Amplitude fading resistance comes from frequency-based modulation itself.

questions.question: 10. For a passband PSK system under ideal coherent detection, what characteristic of the constellation helps minimize BER?

answers.a: Equal amplitude and orthogonal phase spacing

explanations.a: Equal amplitude and uniform phase spacing ensure maximized distance between symbols.
explanations.c: Frequency separation applies to FSK, not PSK.
explanations.d: Pulse shaping reduces ISI, not BER directly under ideal detection.
